Name: Baked Mac and Cheese
Steps: Preheat the oven to 400 degrees Fahrenheit.
Cook the elbow pasta according to the package instructions until al dente. Drain and set aside.
In a medium saucepan, melt the butter over low heat.
Stir in the milk, mozzarella cheese, sharp cheddar cheese, and colby jack cheese until the mixture is smooth and the cheese has melted.
In a bowl, beat the eggs and then stir them into the cheese mixture.
Season the cheese mixture with salt, black pepper, and onion powder. Mix well.
Combine the cooked pasta with the cheese mixture, ensuring the pasta is evenly coated.
Transfer the pasta mixture to a large baking dish and spread it out evenly.
Top with additional shredded cheese if desired.
Bake in the preheated oven for 30 to 40 minutes, or until the top is golden brown and the cheese is bubbly.
Allow the dish to cool for a few minutes before serving.

Name: Fried Chicken
Steps: Rinse the chicken pieces and pat them dry with paper towels.
In a large bowl, combine the flour, paprika, garlic powder, onion powder, cayenne pepper, salt, and black pepper.
Pour the buttermilk into another bowl.
Dip each chicken piece into the buttermilk, allowing any excess to drip off, then coat thoroughly with the seasoned flour mixture.
Heat the vegetable oil in a large skillet or frying pan over medium-high heat. You need enough oil to cover the chicken pieces halfway.
Carefully place the coated chicken pieces into the hot oil, being careful not to overcrowd the pan.
Fry the chicken for about 10 minutes on each side, or until the coating is golden brown and the chicken is cooked through. The internal temperature should reach 165 degrees Fahrenheit.
Transfer the fried chicken to a plate lined with paper towels to drain any excess oil.
Serve hot and enjoy!
